data.event: In October of 1756 Viana built several barracks for his army located in the area who had to survive on hunting and fishing.
Thus, the short-lived first settlement in the present city of Salto dates from 8 November 1756, which remains as its date of foundation.

event.title: 1757, Viana and the superior Governor of Buenos Aires, Pedro de Cevallos, built

data.event: In 1757, Viana and the superior Governor of Buenos Aires, Pedro de Cevallos, built a strong fort called San Antonio.

event.title: used its facilities for seven years

data.event: Also in that period, Spanish troops captured the Portuguese colony at Colonia del Sacramento and used its facilities for seven years before abandoning it in 1763.
